title: Final proposals leave SpaceX and Amazon with 4% of $20 billion rural broadband subsidies
summary:
SpaceX and Amazon stand to get about 4% of the nearly $20 billion that states have proposed for rural broadband buildouts, representing roughly 21% of the locations under the federal BEAD program.
The post Final proposals leave SpaceX and Amazon with 4% of $20 billion rural broadband subsidies appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Washington Harbour deepens space portfolio with investment in Trusted Space
summary:

title: How Starlink’s explosive growth is reshaping connectivity in an increasingly connected world
summary:
Part 2 of our Understanding the SpaceX-Era Economy series examines how Starlink’s explosive growth is reshaping connectivity in an increasingly connected world, pushing satellite broadband from a niche service into the mainstream and redefining expectations for ubiquitous access.

title: Welcome, Jared Isaacman
summary:

title: NASA’s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope Completed
summary: Two technicians look up at NASA’s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope after its inner and outer segments were connected at the agency’s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland on Nov. 25, 2025. This marked the end of Roman’s construction. After final testing, the telescope will move to the launch site at NASA’s Kennedy Space […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandengerg SFB
summary: The Starlink 11-25 mission will see the Falcon 9 rocket fly on a south-easterly trajectory upon leaving the pad. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base at 12:42 p.m. PST (3:42 p.m. EST / 2042 UTC).

title: NASA Sets Coverage for Astronaut Jonny Kim, Crewmates Return
summary: NASA astronaut Jonny Kim, accompanied by Roscosmos cosmonauts Sergey Ryzhikov and Alexey Zubritsky, is preparing to depart the International Space Station aboard the Soyuz MS-27 spacecraft and return to Earth. Kim, Ryzhikov, and Zubritsky will undock from the station’s Prichal module at 8:41 p.m. EST on Monday, Dec. 8, headed for a parachute-assisted landing at […]

title: ArianeGroup Receives Rear Heat Shield Mock-Up for ExoMars Mission
summary:
French tooling manufacturer Loiretech has delivered a second component of a mock-up of the ExoMars heat shield to ArianeGroup’s facilities in Saint-Médard-en-Jalles. The development of the European Space Agency’s (ESA) revised ExoMars mission, which will deliver the Rosalind Franklin rover to the surface of the Red Planet, is being led by Thales Alenia Space under […]

title: NASA Software Raises Bar for Aircraft Icing Research
summary: When flying in certain weather conditions, tiny freezing water droplets floating in the air can pose a risk to aircraft. If not taken into consideration, these water droplets can accumulate on an aircraft as ice and pose a safety risk.  But NASA software tools such as Glenn Icing Computational Environment (GlennICE) are working to keep […]
